website_summaries.verdict: If you have a small dog, this is the one to get – same quality and natural ingredients as varieties for larger dogs in a formula that is easy for little mouths to chew.
pros: Small dog owners rave about its little pellets, meaty aroma, and wholesome ingredients
Many report that their dogs are eager to eat it – even those with finicky appetites
cons: Some reports of stomach upset and diarrhea, especially in dogs with sensitive digestive systems

customer_reviews.title: The first bag purchased seemed to be okay, although ...
customer_reviews.text: The first bag purchased seemed to be okay, although our shih zu wasn't overly excited about it, she did eat it. The second bag looked different. Color was darker, smelled different. She ate a small amount and became very ill - ended up in the emergency. Her blood glucose plummeted and was very lethargic. It's hard to say if it was the dog food but it was the only difference so Am throwing the rest of the bag away and will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: kathryne

customer_reviews.title: High-quality dog food at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: After trying to find something cheaper with the same quality, I have finally given up. This is a high quality dog food at a great price point. I have read so many reviews of dog food brands and this is always up there with stuff that costs much more. The variety of flavors is great, but there is only one for small breeds. Since I now expect to keep my little one this for the rest of her life, I bought several flavors of freeze-dried dog treats (Purebites brand, I highly recommend), which I crumble and mix into her meal, alternating flavors. She is much more excited to eat now since it's not the exact same thing for every meal.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany G.

customer_reviews.title: Safe Venison for Toy Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Taste of the Wild Customer Service wrote: Dear Ralph D, Thank you for your inquiry. All of the venison that Taste of the Wild is supplied with is sourced from countries (New Zealand and European countries) where Chronic Waste Disease has never been found or does not exist. Sincerely, April, Product Specialist ................................................................................................................ Thank you! That's good to know. Still, Krutzfeld-Jacobs continues to occur unpredictably from apparently cross-species sources of newly-discovered origin. Neuro-system prion concentration is observed in all cases. Does your firm discard neuro-system tissue from the mix going into your dog foods? RDB ................................................................................................................ Dear Ralph D, Yes, specific risk materials (SRM) are removed. Sincerely, April, Product Specialist
customer_reviews.author: Ralph D. Blakeslee

customer_reviews.title: only complex carbs
customer_reviews.text: When we got our Border Terrier puppy at 11 weeks old she scratched constantly. She was eating a Purina Puppy kibble, I switched her to TOW puppy and the itching stopped in 3 days. Recently I switched her to the TOW small breed and she loves it. The itching can be caused by an over growth of yeast which is fed by sugars that the body makes from simple carbs so stay away from foods with grains,rice, white potatoes, and feed only complex carbs like peas, lentils, sweet potatoes. Also, meat like turkey, duck, venison, bison, and fish are better than chicken and beef.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Caused severe allergies in French Bulldog
customer_reviews.text: We ordered Taste of the Wild small breed dog food on Amazon, four times, until we realized it was the cause of our French Bulldog's hair loss. itching and open sores. We went so far as to have her sores biopsied, blood work done, multiple visits to the vet, all at great expense, only to realize that an ingredient in the small breed formula was to blame. We stopped feeding the small breed formula, her hair returned, no more itching, but she does have hard skin areas with no hair, on the areas that were open sores.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Kerner Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Bag Size suggestion
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this product. It is high quality and the small kibble size makes it easier for her to chew since she's a small, elderly dog. My only complaint, if you want to call it that, is that the bag contains more food than one small dog can eat in a few months. I wonder if it wouldn't stay fresher if it was divided up into two 14 pound bags, one of which could remain sealed until the first one is empty- given that it is made for small dogs and small dogs don't eat a lot daily.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Fake news.  Great food.
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot of fake news being spread about TOTW. I called the breeder and she said she feeds all her mini aussies and daschsunds TOTW, and has for ten years. None have had any heart problems. She even called TOTW and they said it's a smear campaign against them. Since when are peas, and lentils bad for anyone? Think about it. It doesn't make sense. My 4 year old mini daschsund was raised on it, and my lab has been eating it for over four years. No problems. They are very healthy. It is very good food. I have nothing to gain by advocating this food. I only buy the best for my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad food
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this food and my small 7 pound dog all of a sudden has got very bad diarrhea that I had to take to that doctor's three times. Then today I came home and my other girl 25 lb French bulldog has the diarrhea and it's got to be the food because I don't give him anything else. So I'm a little upset. And I went online just a little while ago to check to see if any other people are complaining and sure enough other people are complaining with this food
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gave my dog diarrhea after a few days
customer_reviews.text: Update- it's giving our dog wet poops and he goes 3-4 times a day. I will switch back to Rachael Ray food. Our Chihuahua loves this food. The pieces are small. The ingredients are great. A little expensive but for 1 small dog it's going to last us a long time. Also, a healthy food will cut down on medical problems & vet visits so it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: ATK

customer_reviews.title: My puppy loves this food!
customer_reviews.text: My year old Maltipoo loves this stuff! He was a stray, and believe that may have something to do with him being a fussy eater. Took me about 6 weeks to get him to stop gobbling all of his food at one time, and now he snacks on his breakfast all day long -- he does finish it, which he did not do with some other brands. He also likes the smaller size kibbles which makes it easier for him to eat. This food also seems to increase his energy level, although I don't know if that is always a good thing as he wears me out watching him race around the yard, which is 3 acres.
customer_reviews.author: Diane C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Food
customer_reviews.text: We've given this food to our two pugs for about a year now. There are many reasons why I love this brand so much: 1. They have a small breed bag which has smaller pieces, perfect for our pugs. 2. The ingredients list is very basic and has great ingredients. 3. It's on prime so it's delivered to our door very quickly. 4. Our pugs skin issues have dissipated since giving them this food along with coconut oil. Great option for us, we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Brent Bies

customer_reviews.title: My dogs are thriving on this food
customer_reviews.text: I had them on another "premium" brand for years, and the a few months ago it was part of a recall. I switched to this food and the dark tear stains that have been a problem with my girl for the past 6 years or so disappeared within a week or so. I was shocked! So I'll be sticking with this food and hoping that it doesn't get recalled as well.
customer_reviews.author: W. Parish

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs with food allergies.
customer_reviews.text: The old food I purchased for my miniature american eskimo, despite being 'grain free', had a bunch of extra additives that caused stomach distress, anxiety, and countless other issues. Now that we've swapped to Taste of the Wild, his ear infections have stopped, he isn't chewing his fur off of his body, and he is so much happier - I will continue to purchase this dry food for him, and any other dogs in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Sami Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Really Crunchy!
customer_reviews.text: Well to me the flavor is like potting soil mixed with oatmeal and a touch of old socks. Dogs seem to love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rio Bravo Fan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT FEED YOUR DOG THIS FOOD!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have been eating TOTW for years with no adverse conditions. I received a new bag and suddenly one dog was vomiting and had diarrhea. I stopped feeding any of the dry food and switched to cooking chicken, rice, veggies, per vet recommendation. Did this for several weeks, dog recovered, switched back to TOTW. Within days my other dog got so sick we had to go to ER vet. She had inflamed intestinal walls and pancreatitis. She's at home recovering now and I will be making her food from now on.
customer_reviews.author: cahepcat

customer_reviews.title: Something my dog will actually eat!!
customer_reviews.text: It has been such a struggle to find a dry dog food option for my toy poodle from age 3 months to 10 months. He would eat most wet dog food options with no problem, but my vet said it’s very important that he has a crunchy dry dog food for healthy teeth, even if he had bones to chew on. Thankful for Taste of the Wild! No more shopping around for dry dog food and no more wasting food and money.
customer_reviews.author: amarieTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: No more seizures!!
customer_reviews.text: I have sister dogs that were having seizures often. We had them on a well know dog food for years and then switched to another expensive well known food and they still had the seizures. I ran across information leading me to want to try Taste of the Wild. We changed nothing else in their diet or medications other than their daily food to Taste of the Wild and they have not had the seizure issue since. Going from 1 to 2 seizures weekly to hardly ANY EVER is a massive improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Allen Gaither

customer_reviews.title: The dogs love it and get annoyed when their bowl is empty
customer_reviews.text: Switched from Blue Buffalo because Blue was giving my Boxer & Lab loose runny poops. This one is just right. The dogs love it and get annoyed when their bowl is empty. The Blue Buffalo was in a self feeder and they grazed, this food I can't leave the self feeder down, I need to serve them or they would stuff themselves! GREAT price, too. $20.00 less than the large pet product stores in my town.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa A. Adams

customer_reviews.title: My pups' favorite food
customer_reviews.text: My aging yorkie-poo and miniature poodle love this food. I could tell a difference in their skin and coat within a month of using it. They also have less bowel movements because this food has little by-products and the ingredients are nutritious and used by my pups' bodies. The kibble is small enough bites and not too hard for their problem teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Susannah M.

customer_reviews.title: Best there is
customer_reviews.text: No matter what side you’re on, grain vs grain free, this is the best dog food you can get. Period. I have three chihuahuas and they love it. After 30 years of raising dogs and trying many formulas, this is the best. No allergies. Lean. No fat. Nutritious. Try it. See for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Dog approve
customer_reviews.text: Well, I can't really give it a quality control thumbs up since is not me but my dogs eating it 😁But they seem to love it and the kibbles are so tiny that it is easier for my 16 year old Chihuahua to nibble on. So, I will assume the dogs gave it a 5star!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: My puppies seem to love this more than any food they've tried in the ...
customer_reviews.text: My puppies seem to love this more than any food they've tried in the last few years. It smells good which I can't usually say for most dry dog foods. The kibble are tiny triangles which are just the right size for my puppies tiny teeth to chew. I only wish they weren't triangles and think they'd be better if they were round or square round. The triangles corners concern me although my dogs haven't had trouble swallowing them.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Why
customer_reviews.text: Is the review asking about flavor?? I'm not the one eating it and the dogs don't speak english. They seem to like it and nutritional value is vouched for on review sites plus the large size it a much better per pound value than the locally available smallish bags. I'll buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: ONGOING LAWSUITS, LEAD FOUND IN FOOD, NOT HUMAN-GRADE
customer_reviews.text: Check out the lawsuits going on with this brand--researchers have found lead in their products. Not to mention this is NOT human-grade dog food. I am absolutely disgusted I ever bought this product and i hope the company goes out of business because clearly they care about profit over the lives of our pets. Switching to Stella and Chewy's permanently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: USED IT SINCE THE POUND HAD HER ON IT
customer_reviews.text: I never heard of this food, but bought it when I saw this was what the papillon was eating when we adopted her in 2017. I have spoiled my dog tho. I put cut up chicken in as well . I still use it with the veggies and chicken I add to the 1/4 cup twice a day that I give here . Seems to be OK. She does not itch at all.
customer_reviews.author: MEG

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this food but...
customer_reviews.text: Vet told me to put my dog on this diet. He loved the food. Now, recent studies are showing that a Taurine-Deficient can cause trouble with dogs. More research needs to be done. So, now I got this 50 lbs bag of food that my dog loves that I have to ration out. Do some research or wait until all the studies are done.
customer_reviews.author: RevFrThumos

customer_reviews.title: Dogs didn't respond to it all that well.
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of smaller dogs: Yorkie and a Lhasa Apso. I've been feeding them the TOW bison forumula but thought the smaller kibble would be better for them. They didn't respond to the new feed all that much and it caused some loose stool issues with the Yorkie. Went back to giving them the TOW bison flavor especially since this was twice as expensive.
customer_reviews.author: HeftyJo

customer_reviews.title: Haven't Tasted It Yet
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves this. I didnt comment on flavor since my dog cannot tell me what he thinks of the flavor and I haven't tried it myself yet.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty healthy for doggie!
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems to like this food and it’s convenient for me because they sell it at Petco and on Amazon if I don’t feel like driving to the store. I like the ingredients too. The only reason I don’t Give it a 5 star is because don’t get much for your money. Wish they made it a little more cost efficient
customer_reviews.author: Chieko

customer_reviews.title: Larger pieces than normal
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4 pound Yorkie and a dog who is missing a few teeth so the small pieces are very important to me. This order does not look like the previous bag. The pierces are larger than before. It makes me wonder if anything else has changed with this brand
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: Have used Taste of the Wild dog food for many years. I recently switched to another brand but my dog does not like it so I've come back to ToW. Good info on ingredients and their source. My dog likes it. Ordering was quick & delivered right on time
customer_reviews.author: minpin08

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Seems good so far but we are still transitioning our pugs from the prarie puppy food. Our pup has been so excited about this food for about a month while we have stored it in the closet. He would go in an check on it even when the closet door was closed. The image shows a comparison with the totw puppy chow. The lighter one is the small breed formula.
customer_reviews.author: Little Owl

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! My Yorkie loves it. Also sold at Chuck and Dons!!
customer_reviews.text: We switched our little 9 year old Yorkie to Taste of the Wild and she loves it! It has improved her breath immensely! But.... I went to our local Chuck and Dons this morning and purchased the 5 lb bag for $11.99!!!!! So just a heads up. If you don't have a local Chuck and Dons than Amazon is the next best! Great quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Mama

customer_reviews.title: I am very unhappy!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed my dog was getting sick and throwing up. I gave him different food and he stopped throwing up. I gave him again this food and he started being sick and throw up again. I don't know if it is this particular package or the ingredients are making my dog sick. I switch to Origen and he is healthy again.
customer_reviews.author: Khatoonik Katie Ghazarian

customer_reviews.title: Fast Delivery
customer_reviews.text: The dogs haven't tried this kind yet, but they love all the other Taste of the Wild flavors, so I am sure they will love this one too. Taste of the Wild is a very high quality dog food at a reasonable price. I just had to write a review since i was pleasantly surprised to receive this almost a week earlier than I was quoted. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Seliger

customer_reviews.title: My little dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I has a high percentage of protein compared to other foods; great ingredients and my dog really eats it well. She is small (about 14#) so a 5# bag lasts quite a while and to me she is worth it even though it is a little more expensive than some others, but also less than some other brands!
customer_reviews.author: Susan O.

customer_reviews.title: Used to be good.
customer_reviews.text: My Yorkie didn’t think too highly of this food. She is a picky eater but this one was I will just eat when I am hungry and when it’s like that just eat a little at a time. She wasn’t very interested in it and her coat wasn’t as nice in this food. I bought this before and my Yorkie loved it and had a better coat with it.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Githens

customer_reviews.title: Quality dog food for small breed
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by the vet for my elderly small dog that was losing weight. I like that I could get a dry food made specifically for my small dog. This is excellent quality and my dog is doing great on it. Arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Love this food for my Japanese Chin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this food 2 months ago for my 1.5 year old Japanese Chin and we both love it!! He was not getting the nutrition he needed from any other brand I've tried and it was obvious with his dry coat and flaky irritated skin. His coat shines and his skin related allergies are completely gone!! He looks and seems healthier all the way around! I would recommend this to anyone with a small breed fluffy dog with sensitivities!!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: my dogs wont eat this.
customer_reviews.text: the first few bags were great. my dogs ate it. now the last (& i have one not opened) they wont eat. i even let it sit out all day. only W eats it & he will eat anything when hungry. :(
customer_reviews.author: D Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good food for most dogs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my picky dog. I thought he would love this food it had good reviews and ingredients but not his fav so he is not always eating it. Not sure why that’s why the 4 stars. Only the dog knows for sure
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: It’s just ok...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought taste of the wild before (dog and cat food). My dogs (cavalier king charles spaniels) like it at first but grow tired of it. They’re not picky eaters. My cat doesn’t like it after a few weeks but he likes the dogs food.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Johndrow

customer_reviews.title: Formula change?
customer_reviews.text: Looks like formula has changed. Just got a new bag and it looks different in shape, size and smell. We'll have to wait and see if the dogs will eat it like the last one. Emailed and wating to hear back from Taste of the Wild
customer_reviews.author: bRaZuKa

customer_reviews.title: Not only grain free but truly chicken free!!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs absolutely adore this food!! It’s one of the few dry dog foods that I’ve found that is not only “grain free” but truly chicken free as well. My younger dog doesn’t do well with dog food that has chicken and I was shocked how many brands use chicken meal and fat in ALL their recipes!! I am very happy with this brand of food and will continue to buy :)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Murff

customer_reviews.title: Feed your dog right.
customer_reviews.text: Super food for your small dog. Don't feed the pet you love crap dog food. Taste of the wild is one of the best dry dog food I have found over 20 years. Buy it your dog will love you for it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year young poodle mix -is a picky eater. I caught him sampling this from a visiting pet's dog bowl and thought I would give it a try. He now clears his bowl immediately and has has more pep in his step.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: My chihuahua prefers this brand over others
customer_reviews.text: My dog prefers this kibble over Nutro small breed. He is 7 pound, 12 year old chihuahua mix. Taste of the wild small breed kibbles are smaller but I think it’s the taste he prefers since he seems to love my dad’s big dog kibble too ;) It has high quality ingredients and the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sized kibble
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad TOTW came out with a dog food for the little ones. My dog is a 15 pound peekapoo and he loves this food, it is the perfect kibble size for him. I wish TOTW made a small breed version for all their flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Finally, my dog is scratching less since he's allergic to chicken. I just wish this product is sold 8# instead of 5#~14#. I buy 5 since I don't want the food to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Sure Works for our Westie
customer_reviews.text: Researched dog foods and found this to be the most recommended food for our Westie. I placed a bowl of the food we used to feed her next to a bowl of Taste of the Wild. As advertised, she doesn't touch her former food any more. Our once finicky eater now empties her bowl every day.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Guy

customer_reviews.title: My dog's favorite dog food
customer_reviews.text: I own two italian greyhounds, and this is their favorite dog food. I like that it comes with a flavor specifically for small breeds. Good ingredients too! High quality and good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Doggie approved!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only dog kibble my chihuahuas will eat- they were on a boiled chicken/potato mixture for years and we tried royal canin, blue buffalo, and a few others and they wouldn't touch them.. we tried this since a friend recommended it and without hesitation they gobbled it down! What a relief!!
customer_reviews.author: brittanylynn885

customer_reviews.title: Yes, she loves it
customer_reviews.text: My chihuahua devoured this food as soon as I served it to her. I can tell she loves it. I tried different taste of the wild flavors, but seems like I'm sticking with this one. She has a beautiful coat and is super active. Super healthy dog.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Healthier than other brands.
customer_reviews.text: We changed our dogs food to another well known brand. Our vet told us to watch for weight gain. I looked around and found Taste of the Wild with Venison as the main ingredient, which is leaner than most beef. We are very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog allergic...
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing quality product, I’m not going to lie. But, my dog is unfortunately allergic to it, so that’s why I cut off two stars. (She vomited and has diarrhea) Overall, though, Is recommend it for other pet parents.
customer_reviews.author: AnimalMama314

customer_reviews.title: Veterinarian Approved
customer_reviews.text: My vet told me this was an excellent choice! Also, it comes in tiny bites for small dogs. My chihuahua is only 3 pounds, so she can only eat small bites. AND, she seems to love the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This was not high quality food. When mixed with better food, the dogs always ate the better food and left this. Also, their poops were huge and frequent on this food, which tells me that there's probably more "junk" than nutrition in it.
customer_reviews.author: calliope

customer_reviews.title: Decent food
customer_reviews.text: Dogs like and seems to be good for them. I heard this brand was linked to some health issues in dogs recently though. Do your research before you pick a brand.
customer_reviews.author: JWright

customer_reviews.title: Our dog love's this product!
customer_reviews.text: When mealtime calls . . . our Yorkie is ready for Call of the Wild dog food. She enjoys the small breed Venison flavor. We mix a little water to make a gravy. She eats it up.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: I will stay with this brand
customer_reviews.text: Doggie's favorite food so far. The food bowl is cleaned up almost as soon as I put the food down.
customer_reviews.author: Mae H.

customer_reviews.title: Hunger strike
customer_reviews.text: The dog food may be rated the best, but my two toy poodles are waging a hunger strike and refuse to eat it. I can’t rate it high, if it Is not eaten.
customer_reviews.author: Linda T. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give you a review that would make a difference. It has a great smell and the size is also good. My Shorkie is just a pain when it comes to food. I have it mixed with a small amount of his old food that he was eating.
customer_reviews.author: CCC

customer_reviews.title: Great ingredient List
customer_reviews.text: This food has great quality ingredients! My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Tori Foster

customer_reviews.title: The Best I've Found.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying this. Our 13 lb Havanese love it. They are healthy and regular with firm stools. What more could you ask for.
customer_reviews.author: AHG3rd

customer_reviews.title: My dog likes it
customer_reviews.text: Have bought this brand before in a different flavor. Accidentally got the puppy bag the last time. All that matters is my dog likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Wooldridge

customer_reviews.title: Good Food, just not for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I do think this food is a good product. The only thing is my dogs did not take to it after a couple weeks. Now I have a big bag of dog food that is going to waste. I sure would like to find someone around my area that could use it for their dogs.
customer_reviews.author: dannyd

customer_reviews.title: It's decent
customer_reviews.text: If the dogs like it... I'm happy. They do. So I am. $5 cheaper than my local pet store. I bought the 30lb bag of venison "flavor"
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Lynn

customer_reviews.title: like the product
customer_reviews.text: I stated earlier that my dogs didn't like this particular dog food. I tried, again, and they seem to really like it. Therefore, please charge me for this product. I am so sorry for the inconvience. I will order in the future. Thanks/Wanda
customer_reviews.author: Wanda A.

customer_reviews.title: Good brand.
customer_reviews.text: Pup used to eat this food and it was great. I only switched because I couldn’t find it locally anymore when I forgot to reorder
customer_reviews.author: Mwilliams

customer_reviews.title: Great food, the dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: This food was recommended by someone at our rescue org. Our neglected little guys grew a nice shiny healthy coat after beginning this diet. The venison mix does not induce any food allergies.
customer_reviews.author: andrewscj

customer_reviews.title: It's been a full year of a full pup
customer_reviews.text: We've had our dog (spaniel/poodle mix) on Taste of the Wild for a year now. Of all the dog foods we've put him on, this one is the best. Dog is happy, active, glossy coat, teeth in shape. No issues with the transition to the new food. Weight is also in control. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Walruseen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product , my dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: Great product!! My chihuahua is picky eater. She always left the food and never finished before with other brands. But she loved this one. She finishes and wants more. I just have to be careful over feeding her. I feel like she is more energetic too.
customer_reviews.author: Sam N.

customer_reviews.title: Research reports cardiovascular  issues?
customer_reviews.text: Modifying my review due to reported cardiovascular issues. Wish I hadn’t used it fir the first year of my pups life but I was trying to give them a better chance.
customer_reviews.author: DM Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Good food
customer_reviews.text: A week on this And my two pugs (10 and 7) have had significantly less gas. Noticed anal gland leaking which she hasn't done in a while, could wear off as she adjusts to the food
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: My small dogs love the Small breed version of Taste of the Wild
customer_reviews.text: I have picky little dogs - Chihuahua mixes. I have wasted so much dry dog food of every product available in the grocery store over the years because they just would never finish their bowls. Until now. After discovering Taste of the Wild for small breeds, rarely does a single tiny kernel go to waste. They gobble it up in the morning, then free feed until the evening, then voila, empty bowls. Even though it costs more than Purina, Mighty Dog, etc. I spend less in the long run due to no waste.
customer_reviews.author: AMY JUSTINE KOKX

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive dog? This brand is for you!
customer_reviews.text: We have an 11-year-old mutt born and raised in our home that is allergic to everything so I mostly cook for her but when she does get kibble this is the one. We tried oh so many a d this is the only brand that doesn't contribute to her misery.
customer_reviews.author: ACWinOH

customer_reviews.title: Kibble is small enough for a 4 lb, toothless yorkie
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a 6 year old Yorkie who had to have all of his teeth extracted due to periodontal disease. He refuses to eat canned food. A vet had started him on a tiny kibble that he likes, but I was hoping to find a food that offered better nutrition. After trying 5 or 6 other brands that he refused to eat, I discovered this formula of TOW so decided to give it a try. The little guy gobbled it right up! So now we are BOTH happy.
customer_reviews.author: AmyDee

customer_reviews.title: My Yorkie Isn't A Fan
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9 year old male unaltered Yorkie, and he was unfortunately not a fan. My mother's dog - a senior female terrier mix; however, loves the food.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: 1 out of 2 dogs like it
customer_reviews.text: The Shih Tzu likes it, the wanna be princess Poodle/Maltese/King "Cavy" mix doesn't. Still looking for a quality brand they both like. Worse than children. They'll just have to eat this, but we'll try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: 2020Trader

customer_reviews.title: Helped with digestion issues but hard to chew
customer_reviews.text: My dog doesn’t love this food but it’s the only food that hasn’t given him diarrhea. Really firmed up his poop and he’s had less digestive issues. I would recommend buying this for a dog with a sensitive stomach. The kibble bites are pretty small but quite tuff to chew I put it in an air tight container and that seemed to help. It’s a good product just maybe not the best.
customer_reviews.author: Francis O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy It
customer_reviews.text: This dog food gave my dog a horrible rash. He scratched at it until it became a real health hazard. Stopped the food and the rash went away. Started it back up a few week later and it came back. Little bumps all over his body. He never had a problem with rash’s until I switched him to this food. Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Taste seems to be of for my bulldog
customer_reviews.text: Kibble easy to chew to a four year old bulldog and mixed breed dog. First day ate food as if they had never seen a meal in a few days. Afterwards they started to stall, each day eating less. Stools are firm with scant odor.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Rolando Medina

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: My schnauzer only eats Taste of the Wild. This is a lot cheaper on Amazon then at Petco.
customer_reviews.author: C Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good if you’re a dog
customer_reviews.text: I think this dog food tastes terrible but my dog seems to like it and she’s the one who has to eat it anyway. And if I was trapped in my house and all I had to eat was this dog food while I waited for help, I could eat it. I would need a lot of water though.
customer_reviews.author: Knowah

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this stuff. It's in small bites, which is perfect for my little dogs. Note: If your dog is needing to lose a pound or two, this is not the dog food for you. We put our dog on a reduced food diet and he lost no weight on this food. This stuff is very hearty and well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: gaskell_reader

customer_reviews.title: What is this?
customer_reviews.text: I’m unsure what this is. It’s not the same size or shape of the taste of wild small breed I buy in a retail store. It’s too big. Goi g directly in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: The Masked Chicken

customer_reviews.title: Expired!
customer_reviews.text: Expired! Expiration date of over a year ago. Exp.March 2016.

customer_reviews.title: not good for skin care
customer_reviews.text: My dogs did not like food.experience an allergic reaction of itching, although I am not convenience that was the foods fault. they coats were dull and flaky skin. tried it for two months

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for an easy, pleasant transaction. Excellent buyer. highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for an easy, pleasant transaction. Excellent buyer. highly recommended

customer_reviews.title: My yorkie loves this food
customer_reviews.text: My yorkie loves this food! Previously, she was eating wellness core dog food... I would always have to doctrine it up with cheese etc. to get her to eat it. But, this taste of the wild food, she eats it right up, loves it.
customer_reviews.author: DcCray

customer_reviews.title: Good dog food
customer_reviews.text: The little picky chihuahua and the minpin love this food and it is reasonable for a grain free food.
customer_reviews.author: V. E. Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and Happy
customer_reviews.text: My precious babies (bichon) love this food. They digest this very well and no adverse reactions. Their coats are shiny and healthy. I just feel good feeding this to our adored fur babies.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Girl

customer_reviews.title: I have some picky dogs but they love this food so much and its now the only ...
customer_reviews.text: I have some picky dogs but they love this food so much and its now the only food I will buy them

customer_reviews.title: He had to get pretty darned hungry to eat it
customer_reviews.text: My dog is not the picky type - but he did NOT want to eat this kibble. He had to get pretty darned hungry to eat it! I finally tossed it out

customer_reviews.title: Toss up try the 5lb bag first because it’s so
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my small dog he didn’t like it fed it to my big dog he loved it

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it! And I'm pretty sure his fur and overall health has improved. The only thing I'm struggling with is that he's in the "no I don't wanna eat from my bowl " stage and he eat them from the floor. But that is not a food issue, he's a brat haha. Anyway, totally recommend the food.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The venison formula is great for my dog who has a rare pancreatic disorder called EPI.

customer_reviews.title: My picky pup loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old Chiweenie is THE pickiest water and this is the first kibble she has ever eaten without wet food mixed into it!!! SO happy I gave this a try.

customer_reviews.title: Small bites for small dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Two dogs loved it. They are 12 year-old patterdale terriers, about 14 and 18lbs. The food is small so they can eat them easily and they like the taste...as in they gobble their food up!

customer_reviews.title: It's one of the top 3 brands and they have always loved it. It definitely helps with skin/coat issues related ...
customer_reviews.text: I've fed my dogs this food for years and I swear by it. It's one of the top 3 brands and they have always loved it. It definitely helps with skin/coat issues related to diet as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Taste of The Wild Grain Free High Protein Dry Dog Food Appalachian Valley Small Breed - Venison
product_meta.description: Size:14lbModern science proves that your small breed dog shares the DNA of ancient canines, like the fox. Years of domestication and excellent care have turned your dog from a shrewd and wary hunter to a trusting best friend. Although their DNA remains the same and their tastes demand something of the wild, their diet should provide them with all the proper ingredients and nutrition they need to thrive. Highly digestible venison protein and small kibble size make this recipe easy on your small breed dog’s tummy and teeth. Probiotics and prebiotic fiber help support healthy digestion, while a blend of venison, lamb, egg, duck and ocean fish proteins provide optimal amino acid nutrition. Rich in proteins and fat, this recipe provides the energy that active small dogs need. Your dog craves tastes from their wild past. Go ahead and give them one.
feature_bullets: A taste of the wild with REAL VENISON as the #1 ingredient; optimal amino acid profile, protein rich for LEAN, STRONG MUSCLES
High protein ingredients with added vitamins & minerals; fruits and vegetables as SUPERFOODS for hard-working ANTIOXIDANTS; fatty acid blend for SKIN & COAT
Ingredients From Trusted, Sustainable Sources Around The World; Made With No Grain, Corn, Wheat, Filler; No Artificial Flavors, Colors, Preservatives Added
Nutrient rich and HIGHLY DIGESTIBLE with guaranteed species specific, PROPRIETARY PROBIOTICS that survive and thrive in the GI tract
MADE in the USA; FAMILY OWNED & run; food made with scientifically advanced food safety protocols; We'd appreciate your CALL 800.342.4808
